        public static double getCellWidth(Cell cell,
                                  int defaultCharWidth,
                                  DataFormatter formatter,
                                  boolean useMergedCells,
                                  java.util.List<CellRangeAddress> mergedRegions)
        Compute width of a single cell This method receives the list of merged regions as querying it from the cell/sheet is time-consuming and thus caching the list across cells speeds up certain operations considerably.(${t_cab0378b321746608b9fad3a91a9aee9})
        Parameters:
        cell - the cell whose width is to be calculated(${t_ca42f1f7ee9b4b55952816915a706d0d})

        mergedRegions - The list of merged regions as received via cell.getSheet().getMergedRegions()(${t_288757c187b342a0b2d323ed8a8f25ef})
        Returns:
        the width in pixels or -1 if cell is empty(${t_d1cde1eb8f9b43f28a29c4fc8a92ea2e})

      • canComputeColumnWidth

        public static boolean canComputeColumnWidth(Font font)
        Check if the Fonts are installed correctly so that Java can compute the size of columns. If a Cell uses a Font which is not available on the operating system then Java may fail to return useful Font metrics and thus lead to an auto-computed size of 0. This method allows to check if computing the sizes for a given Font will succeed or not.(${t_7d5ce33a0c4546889cd69cf974101c76})
        Parameters:
        font - The Font that is used in the Cell(${t_c7b2b03f6e7d419b82c15ac4ce98d1b1})
        Returns:
        true if computing the size for this Font will succeed, false otherwise(${t_364daafd5fad4928a4e635a67e5b96ac})

      • getCell

        public static Cell getCell(Sheet sheet,
                           int rowIx,
                           int colIx)
        Return the cell, without taking account of merged regions.

        Use getCellWithMerges(Sheet, int, int) if you want the top left cell from merged regions instead when the reference is a merged cell.

        Use this where you want to know if the given cell is explicitly defined or not.

        (${t_7dcb77c27a6743ccb336be941ba62fd8})
        Parameters:
        sheet - The workbook sheet to look at.(${t_bfeb2352974c45078450b334d40bb06a})
        rowIx - The 0-based index of the row.(${t_0efc20f018924be88c724108fbf0a654})
        colIx - The 0-based index of the cell.(${t_72f0d61744c2457a9237893916cf4db4})
        Returns:
        cell at the given location, or null if not defined(${t_f7dbfe81e7454b5b865679cf1b985e2a})
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sheet is null(${t_47e1c9367a924903be5f37bcedbd7ce8})

      • getCellWithMerges

        public static Cell getCellWithMerges(Sheet sheet,
                                     int rowIx,
                                     int colIx)
        Return the cell, taking account of merged regions. Allows you to find the cell who's contents are shown in a given position in the sheet.

        If the cell at the given co-ordinates is a merged cell, this will return the primary (top-left) most cell of the merged region.

        If the cell at the given co-ordinates is not in a merged region, then will return the cell itself.

        If there is no cell defined at the given co-ordinates, will return null.

        (${t_69c84ae342aa44be89c3c7d6aedff1ef})
        Parameters:
        sheet - The workbook sheet to look at.(${t_f552d07db2ab4712adb4d5cb0ddda1e5})
        rowIx - The 0-based index of the row.(${t_83e15a508dfc47aaa38f6d3766df8117})
        colIx - The 0-based index of the cell.(${t_f38ec2737f844769945196ddbbfc8b2d})
        Returns:
        cell at the given location, its base merged cell, or null if not defined(${t_4492708e6c9a47579703998252cecc1b})
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sheet is null(${t_83f321e1e59f4117ba70d806b3ba141e})
